intro: Coccoloba saxicola, commonly known as the rock coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, typically growing in rocky or coastal areas. The plant has palmately lobed leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes. Coccoloba saxicola is adapted to saline and well-drained soils, making it a hardy species in coastal environments.
